title: Guest Relations Specialist | Airbnb - STR Property Management | $5/hr
job_overview:
We are a fast-growing U.S.-based short-term rental (Airbnb) property management company operating in over 10 states. Our team is remote-first and performance-driven. We specialize in turning underperforming vacation rentals into high-earning listings through smart pricing, guest support, and streamlined operations.

We’re hiring a Guest Relations Specialist to join our support team. You’ll be the front line of communication with our guests, ensuring smooth check-ins, quick responses to concerns, and consistent 5-star experiences. This is a critical role in keeping guest satisfaction high and our operations running smoothly.


Key Responsibilities
• Respond to guest messages across platforms quickly and professionally
• Audit action items provided from your last work shift
• Manage check-in coordination, booking issues, and special requests
• Defer to appropriate teaUpgrade to see actual infomber for escalation items
• Handle guest concerns and complaints with empathy and urgency
• Monitor calendar conflicts and resolve reservation issues
• Maintain consistent and clear communication with teaUpgrade to see actual infombers
• Document key guest interactions and flag potential problem bookings
• Support backend communication and admin tasks during low message volume
• Follow processes and suggest improvements as you learn our systems


Requirements
• Excellent English, both spoken and written
• Friendly, professional communication style with great problem-solving skills
• Fast, reliable internet and a professional remote work setup
• Willing to work EST hours
• Tech-savvy and confident using Airbnb, Hostaway, Slack, and Google Workspace
• Self-motivated, highly organized, and calm under pressure
• Experience in Airbnb, hospitality, or guest services is a big plus


Salary & Growth
• $5/hr + bonus depending on performance
• Bonuses for great performance and added value
• Long-term position with opportunity to move into team lead roles
